text:
Central Park: The Lake, view north, showing the Bow Bridge which spans the neck between the eastern bay and the main body of the Lake.
1892.
Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
Central Park: The Boat House and the Lake.
May 1892.
Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake and the boat house.

text:
Central Park: The Lake, eastern bay, a view south towards the Bethesda Fountain and the Esplanade at the northern end of the Mall.
1892.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
Central Park: Bow Bridge which spans a neck of the Lake.
About 1895.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake ; Bow Bridge.

text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, along the northern shore, near the Ramble. The woman in the foreground is feeding the wild geese. 1923.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another part of the northern shore, near the Ramble, showing some little boys fishing.
Summer, 1923.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, along the northern shore, near the Ramble. The woman in the foreground is feeding the wild geese. 1923.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another part of the northern shore, near the Ramble, showing some little boys fishing.
Summer, 1923.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view south, from the northeastern shore.
July 12, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Two years later, a view nearly the same but including a few buildings on Sixth Avenue and west not shown in the first view. The new R. C. A. Building at Radio City, had it been built at the time, would have been almost entire off the picture at the right.
May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A similar view to No. 1, from the eastern side of the little promontory in the foreground.
Notice the Goodyear dirigible overhead.
May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
Central Park: The Lake, view nearly due south, showing five ducks swimming in the foreground, and the midtown skyscrapers on the horizon. The Hotel Plaza, with the Chrysler Building behind it, is a little to the left of center.
May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, another view. Notice how the Empire State Building at Fifth Avenue is hidden by the building between Essex House and the R. C. A. Building at Radio City. A little to the left of these, just in the center, a dirigible balloon is seen against the sky, probably the Goodyear blimp.
May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, two years later. Another contrast is provided by the fact that this third picture is an afternoon view, possibly as late as four, which explains the blackness of the shadows along the shore to the right.
June 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a rowboat landing platform on the north-western shore. The view is south. May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Northern part, a view south from above "Indian Cave".
May 17, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, two years later, taken from the rock in the right foreground of the 1933 view.
June 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
Central Park: The Lake, along the northern shore. The view is roughly north.

June 24, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.

text:
Central Park. Youthful skippers return to their favorite sport again. The lake in Central Park, New York, where the youngsters are enjoying themselves this bright spring weather.
Pictorial Press Photos, 145 W. 41st St., N.Y.C.
No. 41630
title: Manhattan: Central Park - The Lake.
